name: Robert Pete Williams
description: '''Robert Pete Williams''' (March 14, 1914 â€“ December 31, 1980) was an American [[Louisiana blues]] musician. His music characteristically employed unconventional structures and [[guitar tunings]], and his songs are often about the time he served in prison. His song "I've Grown So Ugly" has been [[cover song|covered]] by [[Captain Beefheart]], on his album ''[[Safe as Milk (album)|Safe as Milk]]'' (1967), and by [[The Black Keys]], on ''[[Rubber Factory]]'' (2004).
